title: Fire Fighting, Flooding and Damage Control
description: Comprehensive test on fire classification, extinguishers, damage control procedures, and emergency response protocols

questions.text: What are the three essential components required for fire to exist?
questions.explanation: Fire depends on three things being present together: Fuel or inflammable materials, Heat, and Oxygen - known as the Fire Triangle.

questions.text: Which class of fire involves combustible metals?
questions.explanation: Class D fire involves metallic fires from combustible metals like magnesium, sodium, or potassium.

questions.text: What does AFFF stand for in fire fighting equipment?
questions.explanation: AFFF stands for 'Aqueous Film Forming Foam' - a type of fire extinguisher used in naval applications.

questions.text: What color is the 9 Ltrs AFFF Extinguisher painted?
questions.explanation: The 9 Ltrs AFFF Extinguisher is painted bright red and can extinguish both general and oil fires.

questions.text: Which fire extinguisher is specifically used against electrical fires?
questions.explanation: The 2 Kg CO2 Extinguisher (painted black) is used against electrical fires as CO2 doesn't conduct electricity.

questions.text: What is the minimum safe distance to maintain from electrical fire when using AFFF extinguisher on 440V supply?
questions.explanation: AFFF can be used against electrical fires up to 440V provided the nozzle is kept 1.8 metres away from the electrical fire.

questions.text: Which principle of fire fighting involves cutting off air supply?
questions.explanation: Smothering is the process of cutting off air supply (oxygen) which helps fire, achieved by closing openings or using CO2 systems.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of Damage Control on naval vessels?

options.c: To prevent sinking and maintain operational capability

questions.explanation: Damage control involves emergency control of situations that may hazard the sinking of a ship and maintaining operational capability.

questions.text: Which zone of damage involves complete destruction and immediate flooding?
questions.explanation: Primary Zone is the immediate vicinity of damage causing complete destruction, with parts below waterline completely flooded.

questions.text: What does the 'Red Zone' marking indicate on naval vessels?

options.c: Area susceptible to immediate flooding or damage

questions.explanation: Red Zone marks areas susceptible to immediate flooding, extending from keel above waterline, with red triangle markings on openings.

questions.text: Under which condition are X, Y, and Z openings all closed?
questions.explanation: Zulu condition requires all X, Y, and Z openings to be closed for maximum watertight integrity.

questions.text: What is the minimum composition of a search party for rescue operations?
questions.explanation: Search party minimum composition is 2+1 searchers operating in pairs for safety and effectiveness.

questions.text: Which device is used for securing cable to buoy in anchorwork?
questions.explanation: Bottle Screw Slip is specifically used for securing cable to buoy in anchor operations.

questions.text: What should be your immediate action upon discovering smoke issuing from beneath a closed door?

options.a: Open the door immediately to assess the fire
options.b: Do not open door, raise alarm 'fire fire fire'
options.d: Check if anyone is inside the compartment

questions.explanation: If smoke is seen from beneath a closed door, do not open it as fire might flare up fiercely. Raise alarm immediately.

questions.text: Which fire extinguisher type is painted blue and used on helo/flight decks?
questions.explanation: PD 12 and PD 25 Dry Chemical Powder Extinguishers are painted blue and used on helicopter/flight decks.

questions.text: What is the purpose of 'Starving' in fire fighting principles?

options.b: Removing inflammable materials from fire vicinity
options.c: Cutting off air supply to the fire
options.d: Using chemical agents to interrupt combustion

questions.explanation: Starving involves removing all inflammable materials in the vicinity so fire doesn't spread and is automatically extinguished.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT mentioned as an everyday fire hazard?

options.a: Carelessness with naked lights and cigarettes
options.b: Cooking oil left unattended in galley
options.c: Using mobile phones in unauthorized areas
options.d: Private electrical equipment without proper plugs

questions.explanation: The documented hazards include naked lights, cooking oil, electrical equipment, smoking, irons, flammable materials, and power left on.

questions.text: What does the 'Yankee' condition specify for door operations?

options.b: X and Y openings closed, Z open

questions.explanation: Yankee condition requires X and Y doors closed with Z remaining open. Y can be opened for passage but must be shut immediately.

questions.text: Which equipment is essential for search parties in smoke-filled compartments?
questions.explanation: Search team members don BA sets, carry extension equipment and run guide lines for safety and coordination.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of watertight control markings?

options.c: To maintain watertight integrity during flooding

questions.explanation: Watertight control markings maintain watertight integrity by controlling opening of doors/hatches to isolate flooded compartments.

questions.text: Which fire fighting method involves bringing down the temperature?
questions.explanation: Cooling is done by bringing down temperature, best achieved with water applied to burning materials (not flames).

questions.text: What type of fire is Class E?
questions.explanation: Class E fire involves electrical fires from electrical equipment and wiring.

questions.text: Which search location is specifically mentioned for casualty search?
questions.explanation: Search must include deck level as casualties may crawl to bulkheads and collapse there.

questions.text: What is the duration of operation for a 9 Ltrs AFFF extinguisher?
questions.explanation: The 9 Ltrs AFFF extinguisher has an operational duration of 60 to 90 seconds.

questions.text: Which zone experiences shock wave damage from explosions?
questions.explanation: Remote Zone experiences shock waves traveling through ship structure causing whip and resultant damage/fire.
